Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.handler

Interface HelloState

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SMTPConnection
    public interface HelloState
    Operations available when responding to HELO/EHLO.

    This interface is provided to HelloHandler.hello(boolean, java.lang.String, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.handler.HelloState) and allows the handler to accept or reject the client's greeting.

    Accepting the greeting sends a 250 response (with extensions for EHLO) and transitions to the mail-from ready state. Rejecting sends an error response; the client may retry or disconnect.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    HelloHandler.hello(boolean, java.lang.String, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.handler.HelloState), MailFromHandler

      void acceptHello​(MailFromHandler handler)
      Accepts the greeting and transitions to mail-from state.

      Permanently rejects the greeting.

    • Method Detail

      • acceptHello

        void acceptHello​(MailFromHandler handler)
        Accepts the greeting and transitions to mail-from state.

        For EHLO, sends a 250 multi-line response advertising available extensions (SIZE, STARTTLS, AUTH, PIPELINING, etc.). For HELO, sends a simple 250 response.

        Parameters:
        handler - receives subsequent MAIL FROM commands

      • rejectHelloTemporary

        void rejectHelloTemporary​(java.lang.String message,
                          HelloHandler handler)
        Temporarily rejects the greeting (allow retry).

        Sends a 421 response. The client may retry the greeting.

        Parameters:
        message - the rejection message
        handler - receives the retry attempt

      • rejectHello

        void rejectHello​(java.lang.String message,
                 HelloHandler handler)
        Permanently rejects the greeting.

        Sends a 550 response. The client may retry with a different hostname.

        Parameters:
        message - the rejection message
        handler - receives the retry attempt

      • rejectHelloAndClose

        void rejectHelloAndClose​(java.lang.String message)
        Permanently rejects the greeting and closes the connection.

        Sends a 554 response and closes the connection. ClientConnected.disconnected() will be called.

        Parameters:
        message - the rejection message

      • serverShuttingDown

        void serverShuttingDown()
        Server is shutting down, close gracefully.

        Sends a 421 response indicating the server is shutting down and closes the connection.
